label: 町人
本: Edo and Paris:  Urban Life and the State in the Early Modern Era . Cornell University Press . 1994
著者: McClain, James L.  and Wakita Osamu
説明文: (1) Merchant and artisan property owners; that is, persons who were entitled to possess, rent out, sell, and bequeath specified parcels of land, who paid taxes and levies on those plots, and who were members of five-family groups and eligible to serve as neighborhood chiefs; (2) merchants and artisans in general; (3) all nonsamurai who lived in cities.
